CIPHER.0.cipherString: I've had to work hard at that easy-going manner you see on screen.
CIPHER.0.question: Solve this aristocrat.

CIPHER.1.cipherString: The splendid discontent of God  With Chaos, made the world; … And from the discontent of man  The world's best progress springs.
CIPHER.1.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(17,16).

CIPHER.2.cipherString: I'm a runner. Not a race runner, but I just love to run, and I don't think I've ever tasted such amazing food like I've tasted in the whole entire New York.
CIPHER.2.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(9,14).

CIPHER.3.cipherString: It's not really the life of cooking that's hard - it's what you make of it and what level you push yourself to.
CIPHER.3.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(11,21).

CIPHER.4.cipherString: I go to nature to be soothed and healed, and to have my senses put in order.
CIPHER.4.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(5,13).

CIPHER.5.cipherString: The spirit, the will to win, and the will to excel, are the things that endure. These qualities are so much more important than the events that occur.
CIPHER.5.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(19,3).

CIPHER.6.cipherString: All the world has been converted and Washington is the modem Mecca.
CIPHER.6.question: Solve this aristocrat.

CIPHER.7.cipherString: The more credit you give away, the more will come back to you. The more you help others, the more they will want to help you.
CIPHER.7.question: Solve this aristocrat.

CIPHER.8.cipherString: I see my role in the Bonzos as being the straight man, in many ways.
CIPHER.8.question: Solve this aristocrat.

CIPHER.9.cipherString: I knew the profanity used up and down my street would not go over the air... So I trained myself to say 'Holy Cow' instead.
CIPHER.9.question: Solve this patristocrat.

CIPHER.10.cipherString: I mostly drive around in a Fiat 500 TwinAir, and that's a pretty small car!
CIPHER.10.question: Solve this patristocrat.

CIPHER.11.cipherString: I started writing because I got so frustrated that there weren't enough plays that had roles for young black women in them.
CIPHER.11.question: Solve this patristocrat.

CIPHER.12.cipherString: You cannot shake hands with a clenched fist.
CIPHER.12.question: Decode this quote which has been encoded using the Baconian cipher.

CIPHER.13.cipherString: The nature of bad news infects the teller.
CIPHER.13.question: Decode this quote which has been encoded using the Baconian cipher.

CIPHER.14.cipherString: Grief is the price we pay for love.
CIPHER.14.question: Decode this quote which has been encoded using the Baconian cipher.

CIPHER.15.cipherString: I have musical ADD, so I like to switch things up.
CIPHER.15.question: Decode this quote which has been encoded using the Morbit cipher. OO,OX,X-,XO,XX matches to 3,8,6,9,4.

CIPHER.16.cipherString: Human requirements are the inspiration for art.
CIPHER.16.question: Decode this quote which has been encoded using the Morbit cipher. OO,OX,X-,XO,XX matches to 4,8,1,9,2.

CIPHER.17.cipherString: Persuasion is often more effectual than force.
CIPHER.17.question: Decode this quote which has been encoded using the Morbit cipher. OO,OX,X-,XO,XX matches to 4,2,7,3,1.

CIPHER.18.cipherString: EVERY CITY IS ALWAYS CHANGING, ON ITS OWN TRAJECTORY.
CIPHER.18.question: Decode this quote which has been encoded with a Pollux cipher. 2,4,8,6,9,5= . . - - x x.

CIPHER.19.cipherString: TO CREATE A LITTLE FLOWER IS THE LABOR OF AGES.
CIPHER.19.question: Decode this quote which has been encoded with a Pollux cipher. 4,8,2,9,1,6= . . - - x x.

CIPHER.20.cipherString: THE ABANDONED INFANT'S CRY IS RAGE, NOT FEAR.
CIPHER.20.question: Decode this quote which has been encoded with a Pollux cipher. 1,3,8,7,2,6= . . - - x x.

CIPHER.21.cipherString: Always look at what you have left. Never look at what you have lost.
CIPHER.21.question: Decode this sentence with the Porta cipher using the keyword honor.

CIPHER.22.cipherString: Love is just a word until someone comes along and gives it meaning.
CIPHER.22.question: Decode this sentence with the Porta cipher using the keyword trucks.

CIPHER.23.cipherString: First I lost my voice, then I lost my figure and then I lost Onassis.
CIPHER.23.question: Decode this sentence with the Porta cipher using the keyword flags.

CIPHER.24.cipherString: Anytime I feel lost, I pull out a map and stare. I stare until I have reminded myself that life is a giant adventure, so much to do, to see.
CIPHER.24.question: Solve this quote which has been encoded with the Atbash Cipher.

CIPHER.25.cipherString: The secret of joy in work is contained in one word � excellence. To know how to do something well is to enjoy it.
CIPHER.25.question: Encode this sentence with the Caesar cipher with offset 22.

CIPHER.26.cipherString: If you so choose, the challenges can make you stronger. If you so choose, the disappointments can make you more determined.
CIPHER.26.question: Encode this quote using the Atbash Cipher.

CIPHER.27.cipherString: Every time I show up to do something here it's considered a comeback. If I came into town and they didn't call it that, I'd be disappointed.
CIPHER.27.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Caesar cipher.
